title: 108_hr4705
content: The "Agricultural Assistance Act of 2004" defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of Agriculture and provides for crop disaster assistance. The "Agricultural Assistance Act of 2004" defines key terms related to crop insurance, including additional coverage, insurable commodity, and noninsurable commodity. Livestock is excluded from the definition of insurable commodity. The Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 allows the Secretary to provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have incurred qualifying losses for the 2004 crop of an agricultural commodity due to damaging weather. The assistance is administered in a similar manner as provided under a specific section of the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001. The Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 allows the Secretary to provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have incurred qualifying losses for the 2004 crop of an agricultural commodity due to damaging weather. The payment rate for assistance is calculated based on whether producers obtained insurance for the crop or not. The Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 allows the Secretary to provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have incurred qualifying losses for the 2004 crop of an agricultural commodity due to damaging weather. Assistance eligibility is based on whether producers obtained insurance for the crop, with different payment rates applied accordingly. The Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 allows the Secretary to provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have incurred qualifying losses for the 2004 crop of an agricultural commodity due to damaging weather. Producers must file required paperwork and pay administrative fees by the State deadline to be eligible for assistance. The Secretary may waive requirements for producers who enter into a contract agreeing to obtain insurance for the next 2 crops. Producers must file paperwork and pay fees by State deadline for noninsurable commodities for the next 2 crops under the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996. Violation of contract requires reimbursement to the Secretary for assistance provided. SEC. 4. Livestock assistance is provided under the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996. In this section, a disaster county is defined as a county included in a natural disaster declaration for 2004. A qualifying natural disaster declaration is defined as a disaster declared by the Secretary under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act or designated by the President under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act. The Livestock Assistance Program provides assistance subject to certain conditions. The Secretary will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to establish a program for livestock producers in disaster counties. Criteria from the 1999 Livestock Assistance Program will be used, with an adjusted gross income limitation. The livestock assistance program will reduce assistance for producers based on the amount received from other livestock assistance programs, as determined by the Secretary. The Secretary will utilize the funds, facilities, and authorities of the Commodity Credit Corporation for implementing the Act, with these funds remaining available until expended. Regulations will also be established. The Secretary may issue necessary regulations to implement the Act without following certain procedural requirements. Congressional review of agency rulemaking will be conducted under specific authority.
